intro: Cynoglossum javanicum, commonly known as the Java mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, oval-shaped leaves and violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and flowers. Cynoglossum javanicum is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
